## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
```{r}

## code voor downloaden Amsterdam listings data ##

install.packages("tidyverse")
library(tidyverse)

urls = c('http://data.insideairbnb.com/the-netherlands/north-holland/amsterdam/2023-09-03/visualisations/listings.csv', 'http://data.insideairbnb.com/belgium/bru/brussels/2023-06-24/visualisations/listings.csv', 'http://data.insideairbnb.com/united-kingdom/england/london/2023-06-08/visualisations/listings.csv')

download.file("http://data.insideairbnb.com/the-netherlands/north-holland/amsterdam/2023-09-03/visualisations/listings.csv", "amsterdam_listings.csv")
library(tidyverse)

prototype = TRUE
n_max = Inf
if (prototype==TRUE) n_max = n_max
amsterdam_listings <- read_csv('amsterdam_listings.csv', n_max = n_max)


```
